title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 23 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from California
summary: The Starlink 11-6 mission will be the fourth launch from Vandenberg Space Force Base so far in 2025. Liftoff from pad 4 East will take place at 6:07 a.m. PST (9:07 a.m. EST, 1407 UTC).

title: NASA Presses on With Artemis as Questions Swirl About the Future
summary: NASA awarded study contracts to nine companies today for lunar surface mobility and logistics concepts to support the Artemis program. Three days into the second Trump Administration, questions are swirling […]

title: Boeing projects additional Starliner losses in fourth quarter
summary:
Boeing expects to take additional losses on its CST-100 Starliner commercial crew program when it releases its fourth quarter financial results next week.
The post Boeing projects additional Starliner losses in fourth quarter appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: US space traffic system upgrade still targeting 2025 amid bid protest
summary:
The U.S. Office of Space Commerce remains confident it can roll out its next-generation space traffic coordination platform this year with contractor Slingshot Aerospace, despite a bid protest from competitor Kayhan Space.
The post US space traffic system upgrade still targeting 2025 amid bid protest appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: NASA awards Artemis logistics studies
summary:
NASA issued study contracts to examine logistical issues for a long-term human presence on the moon despite uncertainty about the future of Artemis.

title: Inaugural Isar Spectrum Flight Expected Within “Next Few Months”
summary:
A Norwegian government announcement has revealed that Isar Aerospace expects to conduct the inaugural flight of its two-stage Spectrum rocket within the “next few months.” In September 2024, an Isar spokesperson told European Spaceflight that all components for its first Spectrum rocket had arrived at Andøya Spaceport in Norway. Isar also confirmed that static fire […]
